questionsData.title: Litmus paper is used to test the acidity of solutions.
Gases have to be kept in closed containers.
Light is a stream of particles and waves.
Ultrasound is heard by many humans.
Modern drugs do not help to control AIDS.
The earth goes around the sun twice a year.
Cloth is a kind of material.
Making new animals is crossbreeding.
questionsData.explain_answer:
True – Making new animals through the process of combining traits from two different breeds is known as crossbreeding.

 تكوين حيوانات جديدة من خلال عملية دمج صفات من سلالتين مختلفتين يُعرف بالتزاوج أو التهجين

questionsData.title: The baby of the horse is called mare.
"Recover" means "to get back to normal health".
questionsData.explain_answer:
Recover=> retrieve, return, get back.

Here's some examples using the word "recover":

1-"After a week of rest and medication, Sarah was able to recover from her flu and return to work."

2-The child had a high fever, but with the help of medication, he started to recover and his temperature returned to normal."

In this sentence, "recover" is used to describe process of returning to a normal healthy state after having the flu.

questionsData.title: "Scare" means "fear".
An event that causes damage is disaster.
Richter scale is used to measure the strength of winds.
questionsData.explain_answer: The Richter scale is a scale used to measure  the strength of earthquakes .

questionsData.title: "Efficient" means "very lazy".
"Turn down advice" means "refuse advice".
A house builder is someone who builds boats.
questionsData.explain_answer: A house builder is someone who builds houses.

questionsData.title: Fruits are grown in deserts.
Loomi is a kind of dried lemon.
To row is to move the boat by using sail.
To drag something is to throw it away.
questionsData.explain_answer: No, "to drag something" typically means to pull it along a surface, often with force. it suggests moving something from one place to another by pulling it. For instance, you might drag a heavy piece of furniture across the floor to reposition it in a room.

questionsData.title: The text is mainly talking about ………..
questionsData.article: A volcano is an opening in Earth's crust. Volcanoes can change Earth's surface in just a few minutes. Melted rocks and hot gases (erupt 1) through this opening. These materials create a landform when they pile up around the opening. Where Earth's crust is weak, liquid rock may push its way to the surface and erupt as lava. Lava is hot, melted rock that comes from a volcano. Some lava coming from a volcano is thick and moves slowly. Thick lava usually shoots out of the top of volcanoes. This lava can build tall mountains layer by layer. Lava can also be thin. Thin lava moves quickly. It can cover large areas of land before it cools and hardens new rocks. Lava deserts have been formed from lava that moves quickly. Volcanoes can be very dangerous, (they 3) often (destroy 2) what is near them, but they can also create new landforms.

questionsData.title: Do you wear ……..uniform in your job?
……. is a compound word.
Ali is driving his car slowly. The word "slowly" is a/an . . .
The suffix …… changes the word "mountain" into an adjective.
Higher and . . . went the rocket in the sky.
This building is the same . . . as my house.
There are some people lying . . . . the beach.
Abdullah must be careful ………… carrying these glass bottles.
He always goes to school early ………….. . he lives beside it.
The cold drinks always taste ……..
The fox……. to the dog family.
My friend …….to be married next year.
We swam in the pool, …… the cool water.
questionsData.explain_answer:
The correct answer is "enjoying" because it connects the two actions that happened simultaneously: swimming in the pool and enjoying the cool water. In English, when you want to show that two actions occurred at the same time, you often use the -ing form (present participle) of the second verb

 

الإجابة الصحيحة هي "enjoying" لأنها تربط بين الحدثين اللذين حدثا في نفس الوقت: السباحة في المسبح والاستمتاع بالماء البارد. في اللغة الإنجليزية، عندما نريد أن نوضح أن هناك فعلين حدثا بشكل متزامن، نستخدم غالبًا صيغة الفعل + ing للفعل الثاني.

في هذه الحالة، الفعل "swam" في الزمن الماضي، مما يدل على أن الفعل حدث في الماضي. عند استخدام صيغة الفعل + ing لربط الجملتين، لا حاجة لتكرار الفاعل (we) في الجزء الثاني من الجملة. نأخذ الفعل "enjoy" من صيغة الماضي (إذا كان أصلاً "enjoyed") ونرجعه إلى المصدر ثم نضيف "ing" ليصبح "enjoying". هذا يجعل الجملة أكثر سلاسة ويوضح أن الفعلين حدثا معًا بشكل متزامن.

questionsData.title: While Sami . . . a newspaper, the doorbell rang.
questionsData.explain_answer: The structure "while + past continuous" is often used in combination with the past simple tense to express two  actions in the past.

questionsData.title: Our problems must be …by us.
Ahlam has just …… her camera.
I saw the snake . . . . in the hole.
The restaurant …….be very good. It's full of customers.
The birds take care of their babies……
Have the girl . . . on her scarf.
questionsData.explain_answer:
Use of have/get + infinitive

You use these verbs to replace other instruction words such as ask, tell or order.

Example:

Ask the boy to put away his bag.
→    Have the boy put away his bag.
→    Get the boy to put away his bag.
Note: With have, the infinitive is without to.
